mymongolib package¶

Submodules¶

mymongolib.daemon module¶

class mymongolib.daemon.Daemon(pidfile, stdin='/dev/null', stdout='/dev/null', stderr='/dev/null', log_err=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Class to demonize the application

Parameters:
  • pidfile (str) – path for the pidfile
  • stdin (Optional[str]) – path to stdin. Default to /dev/null
  • stdout (Optional[str]) – path to stdout. Default to /dev/null
  • stderr (Optional[str]) – path to stderr. Default to /dev/null
  • log_err (Optional[object]) – LoggerWriter object. Default to None
daemonize()[source]¶

Deamonize, do double-fork magic.

delpid()[source]¶

Delete pid file created by the daemon

restart()[source]¶

Restart daemon.

run()[source]¶

You should override this method when you subclass Daemon. It will be called after the process has been daemonized by start() or restart().

Example:

class MyDaemon(Daemon):
def run(self):
while True:
time.sleep(1)
start()[source]¶

Start daemon.

status()[source]¶

Get status of daemon.

stop()[source]¶

Stop the daemon.

Parameters:

  • log_pos (int) – position in the log file
Raises:

write_to_queue(event_type, values, schema, table)[source]¶

Write the new mysql record to a mongo queue

This function write the mysql records in mysql replication logs to a queue in mongo to be processed later

Parameters:
  • event_type (str) – type of sql statement (insert, update, delete)
  • values – values to be handled
  • schema (str) – mongo database name
  • table (str) – mongo collection name
Returns:

mongo sequence number (id)
Return type:

datetime
Raises:

SysException
